codelog.content:
Plan for the day

  • Start an outline of TODOs and skills I would like to read about next. It's hard to stay focused with so many online resources. It is necessary to prioritize!
  • Start logging my programming progress! I found this idea on dev.io, its author is codeidoscope, kudos! I constantly struggle with imposter syndrome, even though I am perfectly aware it does not make sense.
  • Figure out how to attach a global TODO list to all my codelogs. I do not want to plan what I'm gonna do exactly the next day, as I don't want to commit myself to daily work. I've tried that and for a while it works great until I lose the schedule and feel constantly guilty about not sticking to it. It's supposed to be fun and helpful, not a chore!
  • Continue watching Complete Intro to Web Development, v2.

Learned today

  • Piping Jekyll layouts was easier than expected. For some reason initially my mind was looping over it without understanding!
  • I had to double check how to create checkboxes in vanilla HTML. Using markdown spoils you!
  • You can indeed parameterize your templates! (see docs)
